comment: Let ` L ` be the limit, if one exists, of the ratio ` ( abs `` ( ( A `` ( k + 1 ) ) / ( A `` k ) ) ) ` (as in the ratio test ~ cvgdvgrat ) as ` k ` increases. Then the radius of convergence of power series ` sum_ n e. NN0 ( ( A `` n ) x. ( x ^ n ) ) ` is ` ( 1 / L ) ` if ` L ` is nonzero. Proof "The limit involved in the ratio test..." in ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Radius_of_convergence —a few lines that evidently hide quite an involved process to confirm. (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 8-Mar-2020.)
